lexUnit.name: crowd.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or come together as a crowd.

sentence.text: The pupils standing outside burst in to see what was happening and crowded around the empty cage .
So , there you are in the final minute , boards crowded around you and space becoming limited .

People were crowding round the displays , reading the posters with great intensity and , by and large , in silence .

In summer heather and bracken carpet the clifftops and riots of butterflies crowd the bushes and flowers .

Hundreds of people crowded into St Briavels church last night to see the Reverend Patricia Pinkerton installed in her new parish .
